item.title: Maximum Likelihood Estimation of the Spatial Durbin Model
item.description: body { text-align: justify} This is an R Markdown document that documents my solution to the first assignment in the ‚ÄúRegression Analysis for Spatial Data‚Äù course. The course was taught by Professor Dr.¬†Roland F√ºss and Dr.¬†Zeno Adams as part of the GSERM Summer School 2020. Use a maximum likelihood framework to estimate the Spatial Durbin Model \(Y = \rho WY + X\beta + \lambda WX + \epsilon\), with house price growth as the dependent variable \(Y\), and an intercept and the growth rate in the housing stock as the regressors \(X\).
